posts.name: Zachary Seebeck
posts.cooked:
Hi all,

We’re using Rev Robotic’s MaxSwerve drive this year. Currently we have it set up with a Neo as the drive motor, a Neo 550 as the turn motor, and Spark Max contollers hooked to both.

We got our frame wired up and assembled yesterday, and with that we’re looking at getting the bot moving. As it stands right now we’re just using the MaxSwerve Java template that’s given here.

We’ve pulled this into our own repo and adjusted everything to fit our bot. With the code provided we can get the bot to drive forward and backwards, but no matter what we do we can’t seem to get the wheels turning.

I’ve confirmed that the CAN id’s are correct, and can control them through my own (seperate) code without a problem.

Is there anything anyone can see that would be causing an issue? Becuase I can’t see anything, and we’d like to have this working sooner than later.

Here’s the link to our repository on GitHub.

Contribute to FIRST-Team-6071/MaxSwerve-Testing development by creating an account on GitHub.

Thanks!

link_counts.title: FIRST SWERVE Motor Joystick Inputs Not Configured

posts.name: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)
posts.cooked: You could update RevLib.  It is behind a version of you updated the controllers already that could be an issue.
posts.display_username: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)

posts.cooked: What do the LED’s on your turn motor Spark Maxes do when you try to turn?

posts.name: Zachary Seebeck
posts.cooked: Updated RevLIB, and confirmed all controllers have been updated. No change.

reply_to_user.name: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)

posts.name: Zachary Seebeck
posts.cooked: They continue to blink between orange and purple. It’s as if the library is sending no commands to them.

Orange and Purple is a sensor fault.  In my experience this usually means the JST internal encoder wire bundle from the motor is not plugged in to the spark max correctly, or it has a broken wire.

Status LED Patterns - SPARK MAX (revrobotics.com)

But I have never used them with the external thru bore encoder.  It is likely you need to tell the spark max you are using an external encoder.

Alternate Encoder Mode - SPARK MAX (revrobotics.com)

image 1052×674 94.9 KB

image 1052×674 94.9 KB

image 1052×674 94.9 KB

posts.name: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)
posts.cooked:
It did work out of box for us, but you may also want to factory reset any older controllers even if in code already.

I would say unplugged alternative encoder wire is possible, but that led to modules spinning for us.  So more likely the encoder wire to the motors.  Check that they are fully seated in the controllers.  Although, strange that they worked with different code.
posts.display_username: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)

posts.name: Bekale
posts.cooked:
Hi @SeebeckZachary ,

I am facing the same issue and would like to know was the solution, please.

Best Regards

posts.name: tkchan
posts.cooked:
shouldn’t it be using the Absolute Encoder mode and HW wise, should be using the Absolute Encoder Adapter to plug into the Steering Controller.

you can also plug in to a wheel at a time and use the USB and REV’s HW Client and done the calibration routine?

suggested_topics.title: Why Adjust Shooter Speed Based on Distance?
